text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was with God in the beginning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through him everything was made, and without him not one thing was made that has been made.
speaker: Narrator

text: In him was life, and the life was the light of mankind.
speaker: Narrator

text: The light is shining in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a man, sent from God, whose name was John.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came as an eyewitness to testify about the light so that everyone would believe through him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was not the light, but he came to testify about the light.
speaker: Narrator

text: The real light that shines on everyone was coming into the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was in the world, and the world was made through him, yet the world did not recognize him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came to what was his own, yet his own people did not accept him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to all who did receive him, to those who believe in his name, he gave the right to become children of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were born, not of blood, or of the desire of the flesh, or of a husband’s will, but born of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Word became flesh and dwelled among us. We have seen his glory, the glory he has as the only-begotten from the Father, full of grace and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: John testified about him. He cried out, “This was the one I spoke about when I said, ‘The one coming after me outranks me because he existed before me.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: For out of his fullness we have all received grace upon grace.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the law was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one has ever seen God. The only-begotten Son, who is close to the Father’s side, has made him known.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the testimony John gave when the Jews from Jerusalem sent priests and Levites to ask him, “Who are you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He confessed and did not deny. He confessed, “I am not the Christ.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they asked him, “Who are you then? Are you Elijah?”
He said, “I am not.”
“Are you the Prophet?”
“No,” he answered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they asked him, “Who are you? Tell us so we can give an answer to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “I am the voice of one crying out in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way of the Lord,’ just as Isaiah the prophet said.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They had been sent from the Pharisees.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they asked John, “Why then do you baptize, if you are not the Christ, or Elijah, or the Prophet?”
speaker: Narrator

text: “I baptize with water,” John answered. “Among you stands one you do not know.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is the one coming after me, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to untie.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These things happened in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day, John saw Jesus coming toward him and said, “Look! The Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the one I was talking about when I said, ‘The one coming after me outranks me because he existed before me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I myself did not know who he was, but I came baptizing with water so that he would be revealed to Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: John also testified, “I saw the Spirit descend like a dove from heaven and remain on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I myself did not recognize him, but the one who sent me to baptize with water said to me, ‘The one on whom you see the Spirit descend and remain, he is the one who will baptize with the Holy Spirit.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I saw this myself and have testified that this is the Son of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day, John was standing there again with two of his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: When John saw Jesus passing by, he said, “Look! The Lamb of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The two disciples heard him say this, and they followed Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When Jesus turned around and saw them following him, he asked, “What are you looking for?”
They said to him, “Rabbi” (which means “Teacher”), “where are you staying?”
speaker: Jesus

text: He told them, “Come, and you will see.” So they came and saw where he was staying. They stayed with him that day. It was about the tenth hour.
speaker: Jesus

text: Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, was one of the two who heard John and followed Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: The first thing Andrew did was to find his own brother Simon and say to him, “We have found the Messiah!” (which is translated “the Christ”).
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought him to Jesus.
Looking at him, Jesus said, “You are Simon, son of Jonah. You will be called Cephas” (which means “Peter”).
speaker: Jesus

text: The next day, Jesus wanted to leave for Galilee. He found Philip and said to him, “Follow me.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the hometown of Andrew and Peter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip found Nathanael and told him, “We have found the one Moses wrote about in the Law, and about whom the prophets also wrote—Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Nathanael said to him, “Nazareth! Can anything good come from there?”
“Come and see!” Philip told him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward him and said about him, “Truly, here is an Israelite in whom there is no deceit.”
speaker: Jesus

text:
Nathanael asked him, “How do you know me?”
Jesus answered, “Before Philip called you, while you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Nathanael answered him, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus replied, “You believe because I told you that I saw you under the fig tree. You will see greater things than that!”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then he added, “Amen, Amen, I tell you: You will see heaven opened and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Three days later, there was a wedding in Cana of Galilee. Jesus’ mother was there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus and his disciples were also invited to the wedding.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the wine was gone, Jesus’ mother said to him, “They have no wine.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, what does that have to do with you and me? My time has not come yet.”
speaker: Jesus

text: His mother said to the servants, “Do whatever he tells you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Six stone water jars, which the Jews used for ceremonial cleansing, were standing there, each holding twenty or thirty gallons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus told them, “Fill the jars with water.” So they filled them to the brim.
speaker: Jesus

text: Then he said to them, “Now draw some out and take it to the master of the banquet.” And they did.
speaker: Jesus

text: When the master of the banquet tasted the water that had now become wine, he did not know where it came from (though the servants who had drawn the water knew). The master of the banquet called the bridegroom
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to him, “Everyone serves the good wine first, and when the guests have had plenty to drink, then the cheaper wine. You saved the good wine until now!”
speaker: Jesus

text: This, the beginning of his miraculous signs, Jesus performed in Cana of Galilee. He revealed his glory, and his disciples believed in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, he went down to Capernaum with his mother, brothers, and disciples, and they stayed there for a few days.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jewish Passover was near, so Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the temple courts he found people selling cattle, sheep, and doves, and money changers sitting at tables.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made a whip of cords and drove everyone out of the temple courts, along with the sheep and oxen. He scattered the coins of the money changers and overturned their tables.
speaker: Narrator

text: To those selling doves he said, “Get these things out of here! Stop turning my Father’s house into a place of business!”
speaker: Jesus

text: His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal for your house will consume me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Jews responded, “What sign are you going to show us to prove you can do these things?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up again.”
speaker: Jesus

text: The Jews said, “It took forty-six years to build this temple! And you are going to raise it in three days?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus was speaking about the temple of his body.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this. Then they believed the Scripture and what Jesus had said.
speaker: Jesus

text: While he was in Jerusalem for the Passover Festival, many believed in his name as they observed the miraculous signs he was doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus, on his part, was not entrusting himself to them, because he knew them all.
speaker: Narrator

text: He did not need anyone to testify about man, because he himself knew what was in man.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a member of the Jewish ruling council.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came to Jesus at night and said to him, “Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher who has come from God, for no one can do these miraculous signs you are doing unless God is with him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus replied, “Amen, Amen, I tell you: Unless someone is born from above, he cannot see the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Nicodemus said to him, “How can a man be born when he is old? He cannot enter a second time into his mother’s womb and be born, can he?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “Amen, Amen, I tell you: Unless someone is born of water and the Spirit, he cannot enter the kingdom of God!
speaker: Jesus

text: Whatever is born of the flesh is flesh. Whatever is born of the Spirit is spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be surprised when I tell you that you must be born from above.
speaker: Jesus

text: The wind blows where it pleases. You hear its sound, but you do not know where it comes from or where it is going. So it is with everyone who is born of the Spirit.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “How can these things be?” asked Nicodemus.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You are the teacher of Israel,” Jesus answered, “and you do not know these things?
speaker: Jesus

text: Amen, Amen, I tell you: We speak what we know, and we testify about what we have seen. But you people do not accept our testimony.
speaker: Jesus

text: If I have told you earthly things and you do not believe, how will you believe if I tell you heavenly things?
speaker: Jesus

text: No one has ascended into heaven, except the one who descended from heaven, the Son of Man, who is in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Just as Moses lifted up the snake in the wilderness, so the Son of Man must be lifted up,
speaker: Jesus

text: so that everyone who believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.
speaker: Jesus

text: “For God so loved the world that he gave his only-begotten Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish, but have eternal life.
speaker: Jesus

text: For God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world, but to save the world through him.
speaker: Jesus

text: The one who believes in him is not condemned, but the one who does not believe is condemned already, because he has not believed in the name of the only-begotten Son of God.
speaker: Jesus

text: This is the basis for the judgment: The light has come into the world, yet people loved the darkness rather than the light, because their deeds were evil.
speaker: Jesus

text: In fact, everyone who practices wicked things hates the light and does not come toward the light, or else his deeds would be exposed.
speaker: Jesus

text: But the one who does what is true comes toward the light, in order that his deeds may be seen as having been done in connection with God.”
speaker: Jesus

text: After this, Jesus and his disciples went into the Judean countryside where he spent some time with them and was baptizing.
speaker: Narrator

text: John also was baptizing in Aenon near Salim, because there was plenty of water there. People kept coming and were being baptized,
speaker: Narrator

text: for John had not been thrown into prison yet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then an argument broke out between John’s disciples and a certain Jew about purification.
speaker: Narrator

text: His disciples came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, the one who was with you across the Jordan, about whom you testified—look, he is baptizing, and everyone is going to him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: John answered, “A man cannot receive a single thing, unless it has been given to him from heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: You yourselves are witnesses that I said, ‘I am not the Christ, but I have been sent ahead of him.’
speaker: Jesus

text: The one who has the bride is the bridegroom. But the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and listens for him, is overjoyed when he hears the bridegroom’s voice. So this joy of mine is now complete.
speaker: Jesus

text: He must increase, but I must decrease.”
speaker: Jesus

text: The one who comes from above is superior to everyone. The one who is from the earth belongs to the earth and speaks in a way that belongs to the earth. The one who comes from heaven is superior to everyone.
speaker: Jesus

text: He testifies about what he has seen and heard, yet no one receives his testimony.
speaker: Jesus

text: The one who has received his testimony has certified that God is true.
speaker: Jesus

text: In fact, the one whom God has sent speaks God’s words, for God gives the Spirit without measure.
speaker: Jesus

text: The Father loves the Son and has put everything in his hands.
speaker: Jesus

text: The one who believes in the Son has eternal life, but the one who rejects the Son will not see life; instead, God’s wrath remains on him.
speaker: Jesus

text: Jesus found out that the Pharisees had heard he was making and baptizing more disciples than John,
speaker: Narrator

text: though it was not Jesus himself who was baptizing but his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he left Judea and went back again to Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: He had to go through Samaria.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he came to a town in Samaria called Sychar, near the piece of land Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jacob’s well was there. Then Jesus, being tired from the journey, sat down by the well. It was about the sixth hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: A woman from Samaria came to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give me a drink.”
speaker: Narrator

text: (His disciples had gone into town to buy food.)
speaker: Narrator

text: The Samaritan woman said to him, “How is it that you, a Jew, ask for a drink from me, a Samaritan woman?” (For Jews do not associate with Samaritans.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered her, “If you knew the gift of God and who it is that is saying to you, ‘Give me a drink,’ you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Sir,” she said, “you don’t even have a bucket, and the well is deep. So where do you get this living water?
speaker: Narrator

text: You are not greater than our father Jacob, are you? He gave us this well and drank from it himself, as did his sons and his animals.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered her, “Everyone who drinks this water will be thirsty again,
speaker: Narrator

text: but whoever drinks the water I will give him will never be thirsty ever again. Rather, the water I will give him will become in him a spring of water, bubbling up to eternal life.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Sir, give me this water,” the woman said to him, “so I won’t get thirsty and have to keep coming here to draw water.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus told her, “Go, call your husband, and come back here.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I have no husband,” the woman answered.
Jesus said to her, “You are right when you say, ‘I have no husband.’
speaker: Narrator

text: In fact, you have had five husbands, and the man you have now is not your husband. What you have said is true.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Sir,” the woman replied, “I see that you are a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers worshipped on this mountain, but you Jews insist that the place where we must worship is in Jerusalem.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Believe me, woman, a time is coming when you will not worship the Father on this mountain or in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: You Samaritans worship what you do not know. We worship what we do know, because salvation is from the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: But a time is coming and now is here when the real worshippers will worship the Father in spirit and in truth, for those are the kind of worshippers the Father seeks.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is spirit, and those who worship him must worship in spirit and in truth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman said to him, “I know that Messiah is coming” (the one called Christ). “When he comes, he will explain everything to us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “I, the one speaking to you, am he.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then his disciples returned and were surprised that he was talking to a woman. Yet no one asked, “What do you want?” or “Why are you talking to her?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the woman left her water jar and went back into town. She said to the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Come, see the man who told me everything I ever did. Could this be the Christ?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They left the town and came to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile, the disciples kept urging him, “Rabbi, eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said to them, “I have food to eat that you do not know about.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples said to each other, “Did anyone bring him something to eat?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus told them, “My food is to do the will of him who sent me and to finish his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you not say, ‘Four more months and the harvest will be here’? Pay attention to what I am telling you. Open your eyes and look at the fields, because they are already ripe for harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text: The reaper is getting paid and is gathering grain for eternal life, so that the sower and the reaper may rejoice together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed in this case the saying is true, ‘One sows, and another reaps.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent you to reap a harvest for which you did no hard work. Others have done the hard work, and you have benefitted from their labor.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Many Samaritans from that town believed in him because of the woman’s testimony: “He told me everything I ever did.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So when the Samaritans came to him, they asked him to stay with them. And he stayed there two days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many more believed because of his message.
speaker: Narrator

text: They told the woman, “We no longer believe because of what you said. Now we have heard for ourselves. And we know that this really is the Savior of the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After two days, Jesus left for Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jesus himself had testified that a prophet is not honored in his own country.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he came to Galilee, the Galileans welcomed him. They had seen all the things he did at the Festival in Jerusalem, because they also had gone to the Festival.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus came again to Cana in Galilee, where he had turned the water into wine.
In Capernaum, there was a certain royal official whose son was sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: When this man heard that Jesus had come from Judea into Galilee, he went to him and begged him to come down and heal his son, because his son was about to die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus told him, “Unless you people see miraculous signs and wonders, you certainly will not believe.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The royal official said to him, “Lord, come down before my little boy dies.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Go,” Jesus told him, “your son is going to live.”
The man believed this word that Jesus spoke to him and left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Already as he was going down, his servants met him with the news that his boy was going to live.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he asked them what time his son got better. They told him, “Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the father realized that was the exact time when Jesus had told him, “Your son is going to live.” And he himself and his whole household believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the second miraculous sign Jesus did after he came from Judea into Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, there was a Jewish festival, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Near the Sheep Gate in Jerusalem there is a pool, called Bethesda in Aramaic, which has five colonnades.
speaker: Narrator

text: Within these lay a large number of sick people—blind, lame, or paralyzed—who were waiting for the movement of the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: For an angel would go down at certain times into the pool and stir up the water. Whoever stepped in first after the stirring of the water was healed of whatever disease he had.
speaker: Narrator

text: One man was there who had been sick for thirty-eight years.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw him lying there and knew he had already been sick a long time, he asked him, “Do you want to get well?”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Sir,” the sick man answered, “I have no one to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up. While I’m going, someone else goes down ahead of me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Get up! Pick up your mat and walk.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Instantly the man was healed. He picked up his mat and walked.
That day was the Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Jews told the man who had been healed, “This is the Sabbath! You are not permitted to carry your mat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered them, “The one who made me well told me, ‘Pick up your mat and walk.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they asked him, “Who is the man who told you, ‘Pick it up and walk’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the man who was healed did not know who it was, for Jesus had slipped away into the crowd that was there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later Jesus found him in the temple and said to him, “Look, you are well now. Do not sin anymore so that nothing worse happens to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The man went back and reported to the Jews that it was Jesus who made him well.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Jews began to persecute Jesus, because he was doing these things on the Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus answered them, “My Father is working right up to the present time, and I am working too.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This is why the Jews tried all the more to kill him, because he was not merely breaking the Sabbath, but was even calling God his own Father, making himself equal with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them directly, “Amen, Amen, I tell you: The Son can do nothing on his own, but only what he sees the Father doing. Indeed, the Son does exactly what the Father does.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Father loves the Son and shows him everything he is doing. And he will show him even greater works than these so that you will be amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For just as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, so also the Son gives life to those he wishes.
speaker: Narrator

text: “In fact, the Father judges no one, but has entrusted all judgment to the Son,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that all should honor the Son just as they honor the Father. Whoever does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Amen, Amen, I tell you: Anyone who hears my word and believes him who sent me has eternal life. He is not going to come into judgment but has crossed over from death to life.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Amen, Amen, I tell you: A time is coming and is here now when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God, and those who listen will live.
speaker: Narrator

text: For just as the Father has life in himself, so also he has granted the Son to have life in himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he has given him authority to execute judgment, because he is the Son of Man.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Do not be amazed at this, for a time is coming when all who are in their graves will hear his voice
speaker: Narrator

text: and will come out. Those who have done good will rise to live, but those who have practiced evil will rise to be condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text: I can do nothing at all on my own. I judge only as I hear. And my judgment is just, for I do not seek my own will, but the will of him who sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If I were to testify about myself, my testimony would not be valid.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is another who testifies about me, and I know that his testimony about me is valid.
speaker: Narrator

text: You sent to John, and he has testified to the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The testimony I receive is not from man, but I am saying these things so that you may be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: John was a lamp that was shining brightly, and for a while you wanted to enjoy his light.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have testimony greater than John’s. For the works that the Father gave me to carry out, the very works that I am doing, these testify about me that the Father has sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Father who sent me—he is the one who has testified about me. You have never heard his voice or seen his form.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you do not have his word remaining in you, because you do not believe the one he sent.
speaker: Narrator

text: You search the Scriptures because you think you have eternal life in them. They testify about me!
speaker: Narrator

text: And yet you do not want to come to me in order to have life.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I do not accept honor from people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I know you. I know that you do not have the love of God within you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have come in my Father’s name, yet you do not accept me. If someone else comes in his own name, you will accept him.
speaker: Narrator

text: How can you believe while you continue to accept glory from one another and you do not seek the glory that comes from the only God?
speaker: Narrator

text: “Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father. The one who accuses you is Moses, on whom you have set your hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if you believed Moses, you would believe me, because he wrote about me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you do not believe his writings, how will you believe what I say?”
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, Jesus crossed over to the other side of the Sea of Galilee (or Tiberias).
speaker: Narrator

text: A large crowd followed him because they saw the miraculous signs he was performing on those who were sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went up on the hillside and sat down there with his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jewish Passover Festival was near.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus looked up and saw a huge crowd coming toward him, he asked Philip, “Where can we buy bread for these people to eat?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus was saying this to test him, for he himself knew what he was going to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip answered him, “Two hundred denarii worth of bread would not be enough for each of them to have just a little.”
speaker: Narrator

text: One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: “There’s a boy here who has five barley loaves and two fish, but what is that for so many people?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “Have the people sit down.” There was plenty of grass in that place, so they sat down. There were about five thousand men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus took the loaves and, after giving thanks, he distributed pieces to those who were seated. He also did the same with the fish—as much as they wanted.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the people were full, he told his disciples, “Gather the pieces that are left over so that nothing is wasted.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they gathered them and filled twelve baskets with pieces from the five barley loaves left over by those who had eaten.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the people saw the miraculous sign Jesus did, they said, “This really is the Prophet who is coming into the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus realized that they intended to come and take him by force to make him king, he withdrew again to the mountain by himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: When evening came, his disciples went down to the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: got into a boat, and started across the sea to Capernaum. It was already dark, and Jesus had not yet come to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: A strong wind started to blow, and the sea became rough.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they had rowed about three or four miles, they saw Jesus walking on the sea toward their boat, and they were afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said to them, “It is I. Do not be afraid!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they were willing to take him into the boat, and immediately the boat reached the shore where they were heading.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day, the crowd that stayed on the other side of the sea noticed that only one boat was there. They also knew that Jesus had not stepped into the boat with his disciples, but they had gone away without him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other boats from Tiberias came to shore near the place where they ate the bread after the Lord gave thanks.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the crowd saw that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there, they got into the boats and went to Capernaum looking for Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they found him on the other side of the sea, they asked him, “Rabbi, when did you get here?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Amen, Amen, I tell you: You are not looking for me because you saw the miraculous signs, but because you ate the loaves and were filled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not continue to work for the food that spoils, but for the food that endures to eternal life, which the Son of Man will give you. For on him God the Father has placed his seal of approval.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they said to him, “What should we do to carry out the works of God?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “This is the work of God: that you believe in the one he sent.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they asked him, “So what miraculous sign are you going to do, that we may see it and believe you? What miraculous sign are you going to perform?
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, just as it is written, ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Amen, Amen, I tell you: Moses did not give you the bread from heaven, but my Father gives you the real bread from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the bread of God is the one who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Sir,” they said to him, “give us this bread all the time!”
speaker: Narrator

text: “I am the Bread of Life,” Jesus told them. “The one who comes to me will never be hungry, and the one who believes in me will never be thirsty.

text: But I said to you that you have also seen me, and you do not believe.

text: Everyone the Father gives me will come to me, and the one who comes to me I will never cast out.

text: For I have come down from heaven, not to do my will, but the will of him who sent me.

text: For this is the will of my Father: that everyone who sees the Son and believes in him may have eternal life. And I will raise him up on the Last Day.”

text: So the Jews started grumbling about him, because he said, “I am the bread that came down from heaven.”

text: They asked, “Isn’t this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? So how can he say, ‘I have come down from heaven’?”

text: Jesus answered them, “Stop grumbling among yourselves.

text: No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draws him. And I will raise him up on the Last Day.

text: It is written in the Prophets, ‘They will all be taught by God.’ Everyone who listens to the Father and learns from him comes to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am not saying that anyone has seen the Father except the one who is from God. He is the one who has seen the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Amen, Amen, I tell you: The one who believes in me has eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I am the Bread of Life.

text: Your fathers ate manna in the wilderness, and they died.

text: At that, the Jews argued among themselves, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”

text: So Jesus said to them, “Amen, Amen, I tell you: Unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you do not have life in yourselves.

text: The one who eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up on the Last Day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my flesh is real food, and my blood is real drink.

text: The one who eats my flesh and drinks my blood remains in me, and I in him.

text: Just as the living Father sent me and I live because of the Father, so the one who feeds on me will live because of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the bread that came down from heaven, not like your fathers ate and died. The one who eats this bread will live forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said these things while teaching in the synagogue in Capernaum.

text: When they heard it, many of his disciples said, “This is a hard teaching! Who can listen to it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus, knowing in himself that his disciples were grumbling about this, asked them, “Does this cause you to stumble in your faith?

text: The Spirit is the one who gives life. The flesh does not help at all. The words that I have spoken to you are spirit and they are life.

text: But there are some of you who do not believe.” For Jesus knew from the beginning those who would not believe and the one who would betray him.

speaker: Narrator

text: After this, Jesus moved around in Galilee. He did not want to travel in Judea because the Jews were trying to find a way to kill him.

text: Now the Jewish Festival of Shelters was near.
speaker: Narrator

text: So his brothers said to him, “You should leave here and go to Judea so your disciples there can also see the works you are doing.

text: Indeed, no one acts in secret who wants to be known in public. If you are doing these things, show yourself to the world.”

text: For even his own brothers did not believe in him.

text: So Jesus told them, “The right time for me has not arrived yet, but any time is the right time for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The world cannot hate you, but it hates me, because I testify about it, that its works are evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: You go up to the festival. I am not going up to this festival yet, because the right time for me has not yet arrived.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After he said this, he stayed in Galilee.

text: However, after his brothers had gone up to the festival, then he also went up, not openly but in a private way.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the festival, the Jews kept looking for him. They asked, “Where is he?”

text: And there was widespread whispering about him in the crowds. Some were saying, “He’s a good man.” Others were saying, “No, he deceives the people.”

text: Yet no one spoke openly about him for fear of the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the festival was already half over, Jesus went up to the temple courts and began to teach.

text: The Jews were amazed and asked, “How does this man know what is written without being instructed?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “My teaching is not mine, but it comes from him who sent me.

text: If anyone wants to do his will, he will know whether my teaching is from God or if I speak on my own.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who speaks on his own is seeking his own glory. But he who seeks the glory of the one who sent him—that is the one who is true, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Didn’t Moses give you the law? Yet none of you does what the law tells you. Why are you trying to kill me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: “You have a demon!” the crowd answered. “Who is trying to kill you?”

text: Jesus answered them, “I did one work, and you are all amazed.

text: Consider this: Because Moses has given you circumcision (not that it comes from Moses, but from the fathers), you circumcise a man even on the Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man receives circumcision on the Sabbath so that the law of Moses may not be broken, are you angry at me because I made a man completely well on the Sabbath?
speaker: Narrator

text: Stop judging by outward appearance. Instead make a right judgment.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the people from Jerusalem were saying, “Isn’t this the man they want to kill?

text: Yet, look! He’s speaking openly, and they don’t say a thing to him. Certainly the rulers have not concluded that he is the Christ, have they?

text: But we know where this man is from. When the Christ comes, no one will know where he is from.”

text: Then Jesus called out as he was teaching in the temple courts, “Yes, you know me, and you know where I am from. Yet I have not come on my own, but the one who sent me is real. You do not know him.

text: I know him because I am from him, and he sent me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they tried to arrest him, but no one laid a hand on him, because his time had not yet come.

text: But many in the crowd believed in him and asked, “When the Christ comes, he won’t do more miraculous signs than this man, will he?”

text: Then the Jews said to one another, “Where does this man intend to go that we will not find him? He does not intend to go to the Jews scattered among the Greeks and teach the Greeks, does he?

text: What does he mean by saying, ‘You will be looking for me and will not find me, and where I am going to be, you cannot come’?”

text: On the last and most important day of the festival, Jesus stood up and called out, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to me and drink!

text: As the Scripture has said, streams of living water will flow from deep within the person who believes in me.”

text: By this he meant the Spirit, whom those who believed in him were going to receive. For the Holy Spirit had not yet come, because Jesus had not yet been glorified.
speaker: Narrator

text: After hearing his words, some of the people said, “This is truly the Prophet.”

text: So the people were divided because of him.

text: Some of them wanted to arrest him, but no one laid hands on him.

text: Then the guards came to the chief priests and Pharisees, who asked them, “Why didn’t you bring him in?”

text: One of them, Nicodemus, who had come to Jesus earlier, asked,
speaker: Narrator

text:
They asked this to test him, so that they might have evidence to accuse him.

text: But when they kept on asking him for an answer, he stood up and said to them, “Let the one among you who is without sin be the first to throw a stone at her.”

You are doing the works of your father.”

text: As Jesus was passing by, he saw a man blind from birth.
