text: Jesus told them, “If you were blind, you would not hold on to sin. But now that you say, ‘We see,’ your sin remains.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Amen, Amen, I tell you: Anyone who does not enter the sheep pen by the door, but climbs in by some other way, is a thief and a robber.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: The doorkeeper opens the door for him, and the sheep listen to his voice. He calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he has brought out all his own sheep, he walks ahead of them. The sheep follow him because they know his voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will never follow a stranger, but will run away from him, because they do not know the voice of strangers.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus used this illustration in speaking to the people, but they did not understand what he was telling them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus said again, “Amen, Amen, I tell you: I am the door for the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who came before me were thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not listen to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the door. Whoever enters through me will be saved. He will come in and go out, and find pasture.
speaker: Narrator

text: “A thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy. I came that they may have life and have it abundantly.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I am the Good Shepherd. The Good Shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hired man, who is not a shepherd, does not own the sheep. He sees the wolf coming, leaves the sheep, and runs away. Then the wolf attacks the sheep and scatters them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because he works for money, he does not care about the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I am the Good Shepherd. I know my sheep and my sheep know me
speaker: Narrator

text: (just as the Father knows me and I know the Father). And I lay down my life for the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: I also have other sheep that are not of this sheep pen. I must bring them also, and they will listen to my voice. Then there will be one flock and one shepherd.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is why the Father loves me, because I lay down my life so that I may take it up again.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one takes it from me, but I lay it down on my own. I have the authority to lay it down, and I have the authority to take it up again. This is the commission I received from my Father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a division among the Jews again because of these words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many of them were saying, “He has a demon and is out of his mind! Why listen to him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Others said, “These are not the sayings of someone demon-possessed. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Festival of Dedication took place in Jerusalem. It was winter,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jesus was walking in the temple area in Solomon’s Colonnade.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Jews gathered around Jesus, asking, “How long will you keep us in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “I did tell you, but you do not believe. The works I am doing in my Father’s name testify about me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you do not believe, because you are not my sheep, as I said to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: My sheep hear my voice. I know them, and they follow me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I give them eternal life, and they will never perish. No one will snatch them out of my hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all. No one can snatch them out of my Father’s hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: I and the Father are one.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the Jews picked up stones to stone him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “I have shown you many good works from my Father. For which of these are you going to stone me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: “We are not going to stone you for a good work,” the Jews answered, “but for blasphemy, because although you are a man, you make yourself out to be God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Is it not written in your Law, ‘I said you are gods’?
speaker: Narrator

text: If he called those people ‘gods,’ to whom the word of God came, and the Scripture cannot be broken,
speaker: Narrator

text: what about the one whom the Father set apart and sent into the world? Do you accuse me of blasphemy because I said, ‘I am God’s Son’?
speaker: Narrator

text: If I am not doing the works of my Father, do not believe me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if I am doing them, even if you do not believe me, believe the works so that you will know and understand that the Father is in me, and I am in the Father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they tried to arrest him again, but he eluded their grasp.
speaker: Narrator

text: He went back across the Jordan to the place where John had been baptizing earlier, and he stayed there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many came to him and were saying, “John never did a miraculous sign, but everything John said about this man was true.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And many believed in him there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a certain man named Lazarus was sick. He was from Bethany, the village of Mary and her sister Martha.
speaker: Narrator

text: This Mary, whose brother Lazarus was sick, was the same Mary who anointed the Lord with perfume and wiped his feet with her hair.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the sisters sent a message to Jesus, saying, “Lord, the one you love is sick!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard it, he said, “This sickness is not going to result in death, but it is for the glory of God, so that the Son of God may be glorified through it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet when he heard that Lazarus was sick, he stayed in the place where he was two more days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then afterwards he said to his disciples, “Let’s go back to Judea.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples said to him, “Rabbi, recently the Jews were trying to stone you. And you are going back there again?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “Are there not twelve hours of daylight? If anyone walks around during the day, he does not stumble because he sees this world’s light.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if anyone walks around at night, he stumbles because there is no light on him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said this and then told them, “Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep, but I am going there to wake him up.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples said, “Lord, if he has fallen asleep, he will get well.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus had been speaking about his death, but they thought he was merely talking about ordinary sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus told them plainly, “Lazarus is dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I am glad for your sake that I was not there, so that you may believe. But let us go to him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Thomas (called the Twin) said to his fellow disciples, “Let’s go too, so that we may die with him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus arrived, he found that Lazarus had already been in the tomb for four days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bethany was near Jerusalem, about two miles away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many Jews had come to Martha and Mary to comfort them concerning their brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went to meet him, while Mary was sitting in the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.
speaker: Narrator

text: But even now I know that whatever you ask from God, God will give you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Your brother will rise again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Martha replied, “I know that he will rise in the resurrection on the Last Day.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. Whoever believes in me will live, even if he dies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whoever lives and believes in me will never perish. Do you believe this?”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Yes, Lord,” she told him. “I believe that you are the Christ, the Son of God, who was to come into the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After she said this, Martha went back to call her sister Mary. She whispered, “The Teacher is here and is calling for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Mary heard this, she got up quickly and went to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jesus had not yet gone into the village, but was still where Martha met him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews who were with Mary in the house consoling her saw that she got up quickly and left. So they followed her, supposing she was going to the tomb to weep there.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Mary came to where Jesus was and saw him, she fell at his feet and said, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw her weeping, and the Jews who came with her also weeping, he was deeply moved in his spirit and troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He asked, “Where have you laid him?”
They told him, “Lord, come and see.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus wept.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Jews said, “See how he loved him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But some of them said, “Could not he who opened the eyes of the blind man have kept this man from dying?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus was deeply moved again as he came to the tomb. It was a cave, and a stone was lying against it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Take away the stone,” he said.
Martha, the dead man’s sister, told him, “Lord, by this time there will be an odor, because it has been four days.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Did I not tell you that if you believe, you will see the glory of God?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
So they took away the stone.
Jesus looked up and said, “Father, I thank you that you heard me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I knew that you always hear me, but I said this for the benefit of the crowd standing here, so that they may believe that you sent me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After he said this, he shouted with a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The man who had died came out with his feet and his hands bound with strips of linen and his face wrapped with a cloth. Jesus told them, “Loose him and let him go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore many of the Jews who came to Mary and saw what Jesus did believed in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But some of them went to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the chief priests and the Pharisees called a meeting of the Sanhedrin. They asked, “What are we going to do, because this man is doing many miraculous signs?
speaker: Narrator

text: If we let him go on like this, everyone will believe in him. Then the Romans will come and take away both our place and our nation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But one of them, Caiaphas, who was high priest that year, said to them, “You know nothing at all.
speaker: Narrator

text: You do not even consider that it is better for us that one man die for the people than that the whole nation perish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He did not say this on his own, but, as high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus was going to die for the nation,
speaker: Narrator

text: and not only for that nation, but also in order to gather into one the scattered children of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: So from that day on they plotted to kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Jesus no longer walked about openly among the Jews. Instead he withdrew into a region near the wilderness, to a town called Ephraim. And he stayed there with his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jewish Passover was near, and many went up to Jerusalem from the country to purify themselves before the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: They kept looking for Jesus and asking one another as they stood in the temple area, “What do you think? He certainly won’t come to the Festival, will he?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief priests and the Pharisees had given orders that if anyone knew where Jesus was, he should report it so that they could arrest Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, the hometown of Lazarus, who had died, the one Jesus raised from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave a dinner for him there. Martha was serving, and Lazarus was one of those reclining at the table with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Mary took about twelve ounces of very expensive perfume (pure nard) and anointed Jesus’ feet and wiped his feet with her hair. The house was filled with the fragrance of the perfume.
speaker: Narrator

text: But one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, who was going to betray him, said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Why wasn’t this perfume sold for three hundred denarii and given to the poor?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He did not say this because he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief. He held the money box and used to steal what was put into it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus replied, “Leave her alone. She intended to keep this for the day of my burial.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, the poor you always have with you, but you are not always going to have me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: A large crowd of the Jews learned that he was there. They came not only because of Jesus, but also to see Lazarus, whom he raised from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the chief priests made plans to kill Lazarus too,
speaker: Narrator

text: because it was on account of him that many of the Jews were leaving them and believing in Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day, the large crowd that had come for the Festival heard that Jesus was on his way to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Taking palm branches, they went out to meet him, shouting, “Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord—the King of Israel!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus found a young donkey and sat on it, just as it is written:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not be afraid, daughter of Zion.
Look! Your King is coming, seated on a donkey’s colt.
speaker: Narrator

text: At first, his disciples did not understand these things. But when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things had been written about him and that they did these things for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The crowd that was with him when he called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from the dead kept telling what they had seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is another reason a crowd met him: They heard he had done this miraculous sign.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Pharisees said to one another, “You see? You are accomplishing nothing. Look! The world has gone after him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there were some Greeks among those who went up to worship at the Festival.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee, and asked him, “Sir, we want to see Jesus.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip went to tell Andrew. Andrew came with Philip and told Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “The time has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.
speaker: Narrator

text: Amen, Amen, I tell you: Unless a kernel of wheat falls to the ground and dies, it continues to be one kernel. But if it dies, it produces much grain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Anyone who loves his life destroys it. And the one who hates his life in this world will hold on to it for eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone serves me, let him follow me. And where I am, there my servant will be also. If anyone serves me, the Father will honor him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now my soul is troubled. And what shall I say? ‘Father, save me from this hour’? No, this is the reason I came to this hour.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Father, glorify your name!”
A voice came from heaven: “I have glorified my name, and I will glorify it again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The crowd standing there heard it and said it thundered. Others said an angel talked to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “This voice was not for my sake but for yours.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now is the judgment of this world. Now the ruler of this world will be thrown out.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I, when I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all people to myself.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said this to indicate what kind of death he was going to die.
speaker: Narrator

text: The crowd answered him, “We have heard from the Scriptures that the Christ will remain forever. So how can you say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up’? Who is this Son of Man?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus told them, “The light will be with you just a little while longer. Keep on walking while you have the light, so that darkness does not overtake you. The one who walks in the darkness does not know where he is going.
speaker: Narrator

text:
While you have the light, believe in the light, so that you may become sons of light.”
Jesus spoke these words, and then went away and was hidden from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even though Jesus had done so many miraculous signs in their presence, they still did not believe in him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This was to fulfill the word of Isaiah the prophet, who said:
Lord, who has believed our message?
And to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason they could not believe, because Isaiah also said:
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has blinded their eyes
and hardened their heart,
so that they would not see with their eyes,
or understand with their heart,
or turn—and I would heal them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Isaiah said these things when he saw Jesus’ glory and spoke about him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, even many of the rulers believed in him, but because of the Pharisees they were not confessing him, so that they would not be put out of the synagogue.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they loved praise from people more than praise from God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus called out, “The one who believes in me does not believe in me only, but in him who sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the one who sees me sees him who sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have come into the world as a light, so that everyone who believes in me would not remain in darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone hears my words but does not hold on to them, I do not judge him, for I did not come to judge the world, but to save the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who rejects me and does not receive my words does have a judge. The word which I spoke is what will judge him on the Last Day,
speaker: Narrator

text: because I have not spoken on my own, but the Father himself who sent me has given me a command regarding what I am to say and what I am to speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I know that his command is eternal life. So the things I speak are exactly what the Father told me to speak.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Before the Passover Festival, Jesus knew that the time had come for him to leave this world and go to the Father. Having loved those who were his own in the world, he loved them to the end.
speaker: Narrator

text: By the time the supper took place, the Devil had already put the idea into the heart of Judas, son of Simon Iscariot, to betray Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus knew that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he had come from God and was going back to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: He got up from the supper and laid aside his outer garment. He took a towel and tied it around his waist.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he poured water into a basin and began to wash his disciples’ feet, drying them with the towel that was wrapped around him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came to Simon Peter, who asked him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered him, “You do not understand what I am doing now, but later you will understand.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Peter told him, “You will never, ever, wash my feet!”
Jesus replied, “If I do not wash you, you have no part with me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Lord, not just my feet,” Simon Peter replied, “but also my hands and my head!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus told him, “A person who has had a bath needs only to wash his feet, but his body is completely clean. And you are clean, but not all of you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, he knew who was going to betray him. That is why he said, “Not all of you are clean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After Jesus had washed their feet and put on his outer garment, he reclined at the table again. “Do you understand what I have done for you?” he asked them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You call me Teacher and Lord. You are right, because I am.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now if I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also ought to wash one another’s feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, I have given you an example so that you also would do just as I have done for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Amen, Amen, I tell you: A servant is not greater than his master, nor is a messenger greater than the one who sent him.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you know these things, you are blessed if you do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I am not talking about all of you. I know those I have chosen. But this is so that the Scripture may be fulfilled: ‘One who eats bread with me has raised his heel against me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I am telling you this right now before it happens, so that when it does happen, you may believe that I am he.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Amen, Amen, I tell you: Whoever receives anyone I send, receives me. And whoever receives me, receives the one who sent me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After saying this, Jesus was troubled in his spirit and testified, “Amen, Amen, I tell you: One of you will betray me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples were looking at each other, uncertain which of them he meant.
speaker: Narrator

text: One of his disciples, the one Jesus loved, was reclining at Jesus’ side.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Simon Peter motioned to him to find out which one he was talking about.
speaker: Narrator

text: So leaning back against Jesus’ side, he asked, “Lord, who is it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus replied, “It is the one to whom I will give this piece of bread, after I have dipped it in the dish.” Then he dipped the piece of bread and gave it to Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As soon as Judas took the bread, Satan entered into him.
So Jesus told him, “What you are about to do, do more quickly.”
speaker: Narrator

text: None of those reclining at the table understood why Jesus said this to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because Judas kept the money box, some thought that Jesus was telling him, “Buy what we need for the Festival,” or to give something to the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as Judas had taken the bread, he went out. And it was night.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Judas left, Jesus said, “Now the Son of Man is glorified, and God is glorified in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: If God is glorified in him, God will also glorify the Son in himself and will glorify him at once.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Dear children, I am going to be with you only a little longer. You will look for me, and just as I told the Jews, so I tell you now: Where I am going, you cannot come.
speaker: Narrator

text: “A new commandment I give you: Love one another. Just as I have loved you, so also you are to love one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, where are you going?”
Jesus answered, “Where I am going you cannot follow now, but you will follow later.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter asked, “Lord, why can’t I follow you now? I will lay down my life for you!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus replied, “Will you really lay down your life for me? Amen, Amen, I tell you: The rooster will not crow until you have denied me three times.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Do not let your heart be troubled. Believe in God; believe also in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: In my Father’s house are many mansions. If it were not so, I would have told you. I am going to prepare a place for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again and take you to be with me, so that you may also be where I am.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know where I am going, and you know the way.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Lord, we don’t know where you are going,” Thomas replied, “so how can we know the way?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “I am the Way and the Truth and the Life. No one comes to the Father, except through me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you know me, you would also know my Father. From now on you do know him and have seen him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Lord,” said Philip, “show us the Father, and that is enough for us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Have I been with you so long,” Jesus answered, “and you still do not know me, Philip? The one who has seen me has seen the Father. How can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t you believe that I am in the Father and the Father is in me? The words that I am telling you I am not speaking on my own, but the Father who remains in me is doing his works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father is in me. Or else believe because of the works themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Amen, Amen, I tell you: The one who believes in me will do the works that I am doing. And he will do even greater works than these, because I am going to the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will do whatever you ask in my name so that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you ask me for anything in my name, I will do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If you love me, hold on to my commands.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Counselor to be with you forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive because it does not see him or know him. You know him because he stays with you and will be in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I will not leave you as orphans; I am coming to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: In a little while the world will see me no longer, but you will see me. Because I live, you also will live.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day you will know that I am in my Father, and you in me, and I in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who has my commands and holds on to them is the one who loves me. And the one who loves me will be loved by my Father. I too will love him and show myself to him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Judas (not Iscariot) said to him, “Lord, what has happened that you are going to show yourself to us and not to the world?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered him, “If anyone loves me, he will hold on to my word. My Father will love him, and we will come to him and make our home with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who does not love me does not hold on to my words. The word that you are hearing is not mine, but it is from the Father who sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I have told you these things while staying with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Counselor, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will teach you all things and remind you of everything I told you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Peace I leave with you. My peace I give to you. Not as the world gives do I give to you. Do not let your heart be troubled, and do not let it be afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: You heard me tell you, ‘I am going away and I am coming to you.’ If you loved me, you would be glad that I am going to the Father, because the Father is greater than I.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I have told you now before it happens so that, when it does happen, you may believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not speak with you much longer, because the ruler of this world is coming. He has no power over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I want the world to know that I love the Father and that I am doing exactly what the Father has instructed me.
“Get up. Let’s leave this place.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “I am the true vine, and my Father is the gardener.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every branch in me that does not bear fruit, he is going to cut off. And he prunes every branch that does bear fruit, so that it will bear more fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You are already clean because of the word I have spoken to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remain in me, and I am going to remain in you. A branch cannot bear fruit by itself; it must remain in the vine. Likewise, you cannot bear fruit unless you remain in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I am the Vine; you are the branches. The one who remains in me and I in him is the one who bears much fruit, because without me you can do nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone does not remain in me, he is thrown away like a branch and withers. Such branches are gathered, thrown into the fire, and burned.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you remain in me and my words remain in you, ask whatever you wish, and it will be done for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: My Father is glorified by this: that you continue to bear much fruit and prove to be my disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: “As the Father has loved me, so also I have loved you. Remain in my love.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you hold on to my commands, you will remain in my love, just as I have held on to my Father’s commands and remain in his love.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have told you these things so that my joy would continue to be in you and that your joy would be complete.
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is my command: Love one another as I have loved you.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one has greater love than this: that someone lays down his life for his friends.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are my friends if you continue to do the things I instruct you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I no longer call you servants, because a servant does not know what his master is doing. But I have called you friends, because everything that I heard from my Father, I have made known to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You did not choose me, but I chose you and appointed you to go and bear fruit, fruit that will endure, so that the Father will give you whatever you ask in my name.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things I am instructing you, so that you love one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If the world hates you, you know that it hated me first.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you were of the world, the world would love its own. However, because you are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of it, for that very reason the world hates you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember the saying I told you: ‘A servant is not greater than his master.’ If they persecuted me, they will persecute you too. If they held on to my word, they will hold on to yours as well.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they will do all these things to you on account of my name, because they do not know the one who sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would have no sin. But now they have no excuse for their sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who hates me also hates my Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I had not done the works among them that no one else did, they would not be guilty of sin. But now they have seen and hated both me and my Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was to fulfill the word which is written in their Law: ‘They hated me for no reason.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “When the Counselor comes, whom I will send to you from the Father—the Spirit of truth, who proceeds from the Father—he will testify about me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you also are going to testify, because you have been with me from the beginning.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “I have told you these things so that you will not fall away.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will put you out of the synagogues. In fact, a time is coming when anyone who murders you will think he is offering a service to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will do these things because they have not known the Father or me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have told you these things so that when their time comes, you may remember that I told them to you. I did not tell you these things from the beginning, because I was with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But now I am going away to him who sent me, and not one of you asks me, ‘Where are you going?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet because I have told you these things, sorrow has filled your heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, I am telling you the truth: It is good for you that I go away. For if I do not go away, the Counselor will not come to you. But if I go, I will send him to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he comes, he will convict the world about sin, about righteousness, and about judgment:
speaker: Narrator

text: about sin, because they do not believe in me;
speaker: Narrator

text: about righteousness, because I am going to the Father and you will no longer see me;
speaker: Narrator

text: about judgment, because the ruler of this world has been condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I still have many things to tell you, but you cannot bear them now.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he, the Spirit of truth, comes, he will guide you into all truth. For he will not speak on his own, but whatever he hears he will speak. He will also declare to you what is to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will glorify me, because he will take from what is mine and declare it to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everything the Father has is mine. This is why I said that he takes from what is mine and will declare it to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “In a little while you are not going to see me anymore, and again in a little while you will see me, because I am going away to the Father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore some of his disciples asked one another, “What does he mean when he tells us, ‘In a little while you are not going to see me, and again in a little while you will see me,’ and ‘Because I am going away to the Father’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they kept asking, “What does he mean by ‘a little while’? We don’t understand what he’s saying.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus knew that they wanted to ask him about this, so he said to them, “Are you trying to determine with one another what I meant by saying, ‘In a little while you are not going to see me, and again in a little while you will see me’?
speaker: Narrator

text: Amen, Amen, I tell you: You will weep and wail, but the world will rejoice. You will become sorrowful, but your sorrow will turn to joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: A woman giving birth has pain, because her time has come. But when she has delivered the child, she no longer remembers the anguish, because of her joy that a person has been born into the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So you also have sorrow now. But I will see you again. Your heart will rejoice, and no one will take your joy away from you.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day you will not ask me anything. Amen, Amen, I tell you: Whatever you ask the Father in my name, he will give you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Until now you have not asked for anything in my name. Ask, and you will receive, so that your joy may be made complete.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I have told you these things using figurative language. A time is coming when I will no longer speak to you using figurative language, but I will tell you plainly about the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day you will ask in my name, and I am not telling you that I will make requests of the Father on your behalf.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Father himself loves you, because you have loved me and have believed that I came from God.
speaker: Narrator

text: I came from the Father and have come into the world. Now I am going to leave the world and go to the Father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Yes!” his disciples said. “Now you are speaking plainly and not using figurative language.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now we know that you know everything and do not need to have anyone ask you anything. For this reason we believe that you came from God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Now do you believe?
speaker: Narrator

text: Listen, a time is coming, in fact it is here, when you will be scattered, everyone to his own home. You will leave me all alone. Yet I am not going to be alone, because the Father is with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have told you these things, so that you may have peace in me. In this world you are going to have trouble. But be courageous! I have overcome the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After Jesus had spoken these things, he looked up to heaven and said, “Father, the time has come. Glorify your Son so that your Son may glorify you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you gave him authority over all flesh, so that he may give eternal life to all those you have given him.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is eternal life: that they may know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you sent.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have glorified you on earth by finishing the work you gave me to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, Father, glorify me at your own side with the glory I had at your side before the world existed.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I revealed your name to the men you gave me out of the world. They were yours; you gave them to me, and they have held on to your word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now they know that everything you have given me comes from you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I gave them the words you gave me, and they received them. They learned the truth that I came from you. They believed that you sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I pray for them. I am not praying for the world, but for those you have given me, because they are yours.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that is mine is yours, and what is yours is mine. And I am glorified in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am no longer going to be in the world, but they are still in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, protect them by your name, which you gave me, so that they may be one as we are one.
speaker: Narrator

text: While I was with them, I kept those you gave me safe in your name. I protected them and not one of them was destroyed, except the son of destruction, so that the Scripture might be fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But now I am coming to you, and I am saying these things in the world, so that they may be filled with my joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have given them your word. The world hated them, because they are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am not asking that you take them out of the world, but that you protect them from the Evil One.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Sanctify them by the truth. Your word is truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: As you sent me into the world, I also sent them into the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sanctify myself for them, so they also may be sanctified by the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I am praying not only for them, but also for those who believe in me through their message.
speaker: Narrator

text: May they all be one, as you, Father, are in me and I am in you. May they also be one in us, so that the world may believe that you sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have given them the glory you gave me, so that they may be one, as we are one:
speaker: Narrator

text: I in them, and you in me. May they become completely one, so that the world may know that you sent me and loved them even as you loved me.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Father, I want those you have given me to be with me where I am so that they may see my glory—the glory you gave me because you loved me before the world’s foundation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Righteous Father, the world did not know you, but I knew you, and these men knew that you sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I made your name known to them and will continue to make it known, so that the love you have for me may be in them and that I may be in them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After saying these things, Jesus went out with his disciples across the Kidron Valley, where there was a garden. He and his disciples went into it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Judas, who was betraying him, also knew the place, because Jesus often met there with his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Judas took the company of soldiers and some guards from the chief priests and the Pharisees, and came there with lanterns, torches, and weapons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus, knowing everything that was going to happen to him, went out and asked them, “Who are you looking for?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Jesus the Nazarene,” they replied.
“I am he,” Jesus told them.
Judas, the betrayer, was standing with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus told them, “I am he,” they backed away and fell to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Jesus asked them again, “Who are you looking for?”
“Jesus the Nazarene,” they said.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I told you that I am he,” Jesus replied. “So if you are looking for me, let these men go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This was to fulfill the statement he had spoken: “I did not lose any of those you have given me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it, struck the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus said to Peter, “Put your sword into its sheath. Shall I not drink the cup my Father has given me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the company of soldiers, their commander, and the Jewish guards arrested Jesus and bound him.
speaker: Narrator

text: First they led him to Annas, because he was father-in-law to Caiaphas, who was the high priest that year.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it was Caiaphas who had advised the Jews, “It is better that one man die for the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter and another disciple kept following Jesus. That disciple was known to the high priest, so he went into the high priest’s courtyard with Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter stood outside by the door. So the other disciple, the one known to the high priest, went out and talked to the girl watching the door and brought Peter in.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“You are not one of this man’s disciples too, are you?” the girl at the door asked Peter.
“I am not!” he said.
speaker: Narrator

text: The servants and guards were standing around a fire of coals that they had made because it was cold. While they warmed themselves, Peter was standing with them, warming himself too.
speaker: Narrator

text: The high priest questioned Jesus about his disciples and his teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered him, “I have spoken openly to the world. I always taught in a synagogue or at the temple, where all the Jews gather. I said nothing in secret.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why are you questioning me? Ask those who heard what I told them. Look, they know what I said.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he said this, one of the guards standing there hit Jesus in the face. “Is that how you answer the high priest?” he demanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If I said something wrong,” Jesus answered, “testify about what was wrong. But if I was right, why did you hit me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Simon Peter continued to stand there warming himself. So they said to him, “You are not one of his disciples too, are you?”
He denied it, saying, “I am not!”
speaker: Narrator

text: One of the servants of the high priest, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, said, “Didn’t I see you with him in the garden?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter denied it again, and just then a rooster crowed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Early in the morning, the Jews led Jesus from Caiaphas to the Praetorium. They did not enter the Praetorium themselves, so that they would not become ceremonially unclean. (They wanted to be able to eat the Passover meal.)
speaker: Narrator

text: So Pilate went out to them and said, “What charge do you bring against this man?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered him, “If this man were not a criminal, we would not have handed him over to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pilate told them, “Take him yourselves and judge him according to your law.”
The Jews said, “It’s not legal for us to put anyone to death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This happened so that the statement Jesus had spoken indicating what kind of death he was going to die would be fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate went back into the Praetorium and summoned Jesus. He asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “Are you saying this on your own, or did others tell you about me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate answered, “Am I a Jew? Your own people and chief priests handed you over to me. What have you done?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus replied, “My kingdom is not of this world. If my kingdom were of this world, my servants would fight so that I would not be handed over to the Jews. But now my kingdom is not from here.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“You are a king then?” Pilate asked.
Jesus answered, “I am, as you say, a king. For this reason I was born, and for this reason I came into the world, to testify to the truth. Everyone who belongs to the truth listens to my voice.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“What is truth?” Pilate said to him.
After he said this, he went out again to the Jews and told them, “I find no basis for a charge against him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you have a custom that I release one prisoner to you at the Passover. So do you want me to release the King of the Jews for you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they shouted back, “Not this man, but Barabbas!” (Now Barabbas was a rebel.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pilate took Jesus and had him flogged.
speaker: Narrator

text: The soldiers also twisted together a crown of thorns and placed it on his head. Then they threw a purple robe around him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They kept coming to him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!” And they kept hitting him in the face.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate went outside again and said to them, “Look, I am bringing him out to you to let you know that I find no basis for a charge against him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus came out wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. Pilate said to them, “Behold the man!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the chief priests and guards saw him, they shouted, “Crucify! Crucify!”
Pilate told them, “Take him yourselves and crucify him, for I find no basis for a charge against him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews answered him, “We have a law, and according to that law he ought to die, because he claimed to be the Son of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Pilate heard this statement, he was even more afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He went back inside the palace again and asked Jesus, “Where are you from?”
But Jesus gave him no answer.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Pilate asked him, “Are you not talking to me? Don’t you know that I have the authority to release you or to crucify you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “You would have no authority over me at all if it had not been given to you from above. Therefore the one who handed me over to you has the greater sin.”
speaker: Narrator

text: From then on Pilate tried to release Jesus. But the Jews shouted, “If you let this man go, you are no friend of Caesar! Anyone who claims to be a king opposes Caesar!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Pilate heard these words, he brought Jesus outside. He sat down on the judge’s seat at a place called the Stone Pavement, or Gabbatha in Aramaic.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was about the sixth hour on the Preparation Day for the Passover. Pilate said to the Jews, “Here is your king!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shouted, “Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him!”
Pilate said to them, “Should I crucify your king?”
“We have no king but Caesar!” the chief priests answered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So then Pilate handed Jesus over to them to be crucified.
So they took Jesus away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Carrying his own cross, he went out to what is called the Place of a Skull, which in Aramaic is called Golgotha.
speaker: Narrator

text: There they crucified him with two others, one on each side, and Jesus in the middle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate also had a notice written and fastened on the cross. It read, “Jesus the Nazarene, the King of the Jews.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Many of the Jews read this notice, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city, and it was written in Aramaic, Latin, and Greek.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, “Do not write, ‘The King of the Jews,’ but that ‘this man said, “I am the King of the Jews.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the soldiers crucified Jesus, they took his clothes and divided them into four parts, one part for each soldier. They also took his tunic, which was seamless, woven in one piece from top to bottom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So they said to one another, “Let’s not tear it. Instead, let’s cast lots to see who gets it.” This was so that the Scripture might be fulfilled which says:
They divided my garments among them
and cast lots for my clothing.
So the soldiers did these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus’ mother, his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene were standing near the cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw his mother and the disciple whom he loved standing nearby, he said to his mother, “Woman, here is your son!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to the disciple, “Here is your mother!” And from that time this disciple took her into his own home.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, knowing that everything had now been finished, and to fulfill the Scripture, Jesus said, “I thirst.”
speaker: Narrator

text: A jar full of sour wine was sitting there. So they put a sponge soaked in sour wine on a hyssop branch and held it to his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus had received the sour wine, he said, “It is finished!” Then, bowing his head, he gave up his spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since it was the Preparation Day, the Jews did not want the bodies left on the crosses over the Sabbath (because that Sabbath was a particularly important day). They asked Pilate to have the men’s legs broken and the bodies taken away.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first man who was crucified with Jesus, and then those of the other man.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they came to Jesus and saw that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear. Immediately blood and water came out.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who saw it has testified, and his testimony is true. He knows that he is telling the truth, so that you also may believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, these things happened so that the Scripture would be fulfilled, “Not one of his bones will be broken.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again another Scripture says, “They will look at the one they pierced.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, Joseph of Arimathea, who was a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, asked Pilate to let him remove Jesus’ body. When Pilate gave him permission, he came and took Jesus’ body away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nicodemus, who earlier had come to Jesus at night, also came bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about seventy-two pounds.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took Jesus’ body and bound it with linen strips along with the spices, in accord with Jewish burial customs.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a garden at the place where Jesus was crucified. And in the garden was a new tomb in which no one had ever been laid.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they laid Jesus there, because it was the Jewish Preparation Day, and the tomb was near.
speaker: Narrator

text: Early on the first day of the week, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene went to the tomb. She saw that the stone had been taken away from the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: So she left and ran to Simon Peter and the other disciple, the one Jesus loved. “They have taken the Lord out of the tomb,” she told them, “and we don’t know where they put him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Peter and the other disciple went out, heading for the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: The two were running together, but the other disciple outran Peter and got to the tomb first.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bending over, he saw the linen cloths lying there, yet he did not go in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Simon Peter, who was following him, arrived and went into the tomb. He saw the linen cloths lying there.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cloth that had been on Jesus’ head was not lying with the linen cloths, but was folded up in a separate place by itself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the other disciple, who arrived at the tomb first, also entered. He saw and believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: (They still did not yet understand the Scripture that he must rise from the dead.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples went back to their homes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Mary stood outside facing the tomb, weeping. As she wept, she bent over, looking into the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: She saw two angels in white clothes sitting where the body of Jesus had been lying, one at the head and one at the feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They asked her, “Woman, why are you weeping?”
She told them, “Because they have taken away my Lord, and I don’t know where they have laid him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After she said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, though she did not know it was Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Who are you looking for?”
Supposing he was the gardener, she replied, “Sir, if you carried him off, tell me where you laid him, and I will get him.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus said to her, “Mary.”
She turned and replied in Aramaic, “Rabboni!” (which means, “Teacher”).
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus told her, “Do not continue to cling to me, for I have not yet ascended to my Father. But go to my brothers and tell them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father—to my God and your God.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Mary Magdalene went and announced to the disciples, “I have seen the Lord!” She also told them the things he said to her.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the evening of that first day of the week, the disciples were together behind locked doors because of their fear of the Jews. Jesus came, stood among them, and said to them, “Peace be with you!”
speaker: Narrator

text: After he said this, he showed them his hands and side. So the disciples rejoiced when they saw the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them again, “Peace be with you! Just as the Father has sent me, I am also sending you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After saying this, he breathed on them and said, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever you forgive people’s sins, they are forgiven. Whenever you do not forgive them, they are not forgiven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Thomas, one of the Twelve, the one called the Twin, was not with them when Jesus came.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So the other disciples kept telling him, “We have seen the Lord!”
But he said to them, “Unless I see the nail marks in his hands, and put my finger into the mark of the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will never believe.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After eight days, his disciples were inside again, and Thomas was with them. Though the doors were locked, Jesus came and stood among them. “Peace be with you,” he said.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to Thomas, “Put your finger here and look at my hands. Take your hand and put it into my side. Do not continue to doubt, but believe.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thomas answered him, “My Lord and my God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Because you have seen me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus, in the presence of his disciples, did many other miraculous signs that are not written in this book.
speaker: Narrator

text: But these are written that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, Jesus showed himself again to the disciples at the Sea of Tiberias. This is how he showed himself:
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter, Thomas (called the Twin), Nathanael from Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two other disciples were together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Simon Peter said to them, “I’m going fishing.”
They replied, “We’ll go with you.”
They went out and got into the boat, but that night they caught nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Early in the morning, Jesus was standing on the shore, but the disciples did not know it was Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus called to them, “Boys, don’t you have any fish?”
“No!” they answered.
speaker: Narrator

text: He told them, “Throw your net on the right side of the boat and you will find some.” So they cast the net out. Then they were not able to haul it in because of the large number of fish.
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” When Simon Peter heard, “It is the Lord!” he tied his outer garment around him (for he had taken it off) and jumped into the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the other disciples came in the little boat, dragging the net full of fish, for they were not far from shore, about one hundred yards.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they stepped out on land, they saw some bread and a charcoal fire with fish on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Bring some of the fish you just caught.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Simon Peter climbed aboard and hauled the net to land, full of large fish, 153 of them. Yet even with so many, the net was not torn.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus said to them, “Come, eat breakfast.”
None of the disciples dared ask him, “Who are you?” because they knew it was the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus came, took the bread, and gave it to them, and also the fish.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was now the third time Jesus appeared to his disciples after he was raised from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When they had eaten breakfast, Jesus asked Simon Peter, “Simon, son of John, do you love me more than these?”
“Yes, Lord,” he said, “you know that I care about you.”
Jesus told him, “Feed my lambs.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
A second time Jesus asked him, “Simon, son of John, do you love me?”
He said, “Yes, Lord, you know that I care about you.”
Jesus told him, “Be a shepherd for my sheep.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He asked him the third time, “Simon, son of John, do you care about me?”
Peter was grieved because Jesus asked him the third time, “Do you care about me?” He answered, “Lord, you know all things. You know that I care about you.”
“Feed my sheep,” Jesus said.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Amen, Amen, I tell you: When you were young, you dressed yourself and went wherever you wanted. But when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and someone else will tie you and carry you where you do not want to go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said this to indicate the kind of death by which Peter would glorify God. After saying this, he told him, “Follow me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter turned and saw the disciple Jesus loved following them. This was the one who had leaned back against Jesus at the supper and asked, “Lord, who is going to betray you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter saw him, he asked Jesus, “Lord, what about him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: “If I want him to remain until I come,” Jesus answered, “what is that to you? You follow me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And so it was said among the brothers that this disciple would not die. Yet Jesus did not say that he would not die, but, “If I want him to remain until I come, what is that to you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the disciple who is testifying about these things and who wrote these things. We know that his testimony is true.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus also did many other things. If every one of them were written down, I suppose the world itself would not have room for the books that would be written.
speaker: Narrator
